online.game
Class square_geo_board

java.lang.Object
  online.game.BaseBoard
      online.game.gBoard
          online.game.square_geo_board
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnlineConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
rectBoard, squareBoard
public abstract class square_geo_board
extends gBoard

common support for square geometry boards with connections in 4 or 8 directions.

Author:
ddyer

Method Detail

newcell

public abstract cell newcell(char col,
                             int row)

topRow

public int topRow()
return the row number that is being displayed visually at the top of the window considering the reverse_y switch. Normally, the top row represents the more distant board elements, and drawing should be from top to bottom.

Returns:
an integer

bottomRow

public int bottomRow()
return the row number that is being displayed visually at the bottom of the window considering the reverse_y switch. Normally, the top row represents the more distant board elements, and drawing should be from top to bottom.

Returns:
an integer

stepRow

public int stepRow()
return the increment needed to step from topRow() toward bottomRow() the recommended iterator for rows is
for(int row=topRow(),last=bottomRow(),stepRow=stepRow(); row-stepRow!=last; row += stepRow) {}

Returns:
+ - 1

rightColNum

public int rightColNum()
return the column number that is being displayed visually at the right of the window considering the reverse_x and reverse_y switch. Shadows are normally cast toward the left, so drawing should proceed from left to right. However, some board perspectives may work better right to left.

Returns:
an integer

leftColNum

public int leftColNum()
return the column number that is being displayed visually at the left of the window considering the reverse_x and reverse_y switch. Shadows are normally cast toward the left, so drawing should proceed from left to right. However, some board perspectives may work better right to left.

Returns:
an integer

rightCol

public char rightCol()
return the column character that is being displayed visually at the right of the window considering the reverse_x and reverse_y switch. Shadows are normally cast toward the left, so drawing should proceed from left to right. However, some board perspectives may work better right to left.

Returns:
a char

leftCol

public char leftCol()
return the column character that is being displayed visually at the left of the window considering the reverse_x and reverse_y switch. Shadows are normally cast toward the left, so drawing should proceed from left to right. However, some board perspectives may work better right to left.

Returns:
a char

stepColNum

public int stepColNum()
return the increment needed to step from leftCol() toward rightCol() the recommended iterator for rows is
int stepCol = stepCol();
for(char col=leftCol(),lastCol=rightCol(); (col-stepCol)!=lastCol; col += stepCol) {}

Returns:
an int
